title: Rotational inertia of a non-uniform rod

content.question: A rod with a nonuniform mass density given by <math alttext="lambda equals, A, x squared" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>λ</mi><mo>=</mo><mi>A</mi><msup><mi>x</mi><mn>2</mn></msup></math>, where <math alttext="A, equals, 5.0 kilograms per meter cubed " display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>A</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>5.0</mn><mo> </mo><msup><mtext>kg/m</mtext><mn>3</mn></msup></math>, is aligned on the <math alttext="x" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi></math>-axis with one end at the origin and the other end at <math alttext="x equals 2.0 meters" display="inline" overflow="scroll"><mi>x</mi><mo>=</mo><mn>2.0</mn><mo> </mo><mtext>m</mtext></math>, as shown. The rotational inertia of the rod about the origin is most nearly
